remarks: The dual of a left vector space is also a left vector space.  Note that scalar multiplication is reversed by ~ df-oppr ; otherwise, the dual would be a right vector space as is sometimes the case in the literature.  (Contributed by NM, 22-Oct-2014.)
statement:
lduallvec.d $e |- D = ( LDual ` W ) $.
lduallvec.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lduallvec $p |- ( ph -> D e. LVec ) $.
